Tue., Sept. 26: Find out more about challenged and banned books in Iowa.
  


Banned Books Trivia Night

Tuesday, September 26, 7-8:30 p.m.
Ingersoll Tap
2837 Ingersoll Ave.
Des Moines, IA 50312

RSVP By Email
Share this:           

How much do you know about banned books?

Free societies read freely. That's why each September, the ACLU of Iowa and the Iowa Library Association celebrate the freedom to read during Banned Books Week.

Join us on Tuesday, September 26 at Ingersoll Tap in Des Moines for a special Banned Books Week trivia night and ACLU fundraiser, co-hosted with Geeks Who Drink.

Banned Books Week is a time when community librarians, booksellers, publishers, journalists, teachers, and readers come together in a shared support of the freedom to seek and express ideas, even those ideas some consider unorthodox or unpopular.

How much do you know about banned and challenged books in Iowa and the Midwest? Test your knowledge with our Banned Books Week quiz or visit our website for a list of books that have been challenged in Iowa.

Happy banned book reading!

The ACLU of Iowa staff
ACLU of Iowa
